name: Warwick Fiji Resort & Spa

reviews.title: Lovel Hotel but expensive to eat!!
reviews.text: Stayed here on way back from London, going home to NZ. The lost luggage in Los Angeles did not dampen our spirits as we entered the hotel we all thought "wow". Lovely looking hotel. We had a mountain view room which was great as it was away from the noise of the pool area. People we met said that they wished they had a room on our side as it was sometimes noisy in the evenings. The hotel is expensive for food and really expensive for drinks so next time we will pay for all inclusive. They wanted $12 for a glass of wine and a not very good one at that.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Only one negative was that the day after we arrived they closed the main pool and pool bar as they were repairing cracked tiles. The tiles were ok but we realised that they were doing it at this time as the hotel was fairly quiet and the following week it was 100% full. We should have been made aware of this before we booked, however we enjoyed our time there.
reviews.title: Chill out at Warwick Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A beautiful but extremely isolated location,suited to those who want a holiday just chilling out on a beach. swimming at low tide difficult due to exposed coral reef.journey from airport nearly two hours.Magnificent location wonderful staff.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel.....But!!

reviews.text: We arrived at the Warwick Fiji after a very tiring trip to Adelaide & Sydney and a hectic tour of New Zealand which took 4 weeks. We just wanted to chill out for a week & then back to the UK. The setting was stunning, beautiful lagoon & friendly staff. The rooms were well looked after clean & tidy. Although we did have small areas of mould in the bath room. A slight minus was that our room overlooked the main pool which we found to be both noisy and disruptive. Hordes of screaming kids everywhere! I was so surprised to see so many - don't the Aussie kids go to school? It spolt our time in the pools because there was simply no where to swim! Could they not introduce a pool for the children and one for adults only? Noise from fellow guests at night where more consideration for others in the hotel at all times should & could be mentioned in the Hotel hand book perhaps?
reviews.title: we luv the warwick

likes.liked: — just the whole lot atmosphere people everything

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The entertainment was spasmodic with very little notice of the days' events or the times of such events that did take place. The hotel was 2 hours journey from the airport!! When you are tired from a long flight like us it did not help. Overall we enjoyed our stay there - would I return?? Possibly but only if certain weeks could be made adults only!
reviews.title: Paradise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From our arrival we were impressed. We were met by friendly staff and a welcome drink, even though it was 10:30pm at night.
reviews.title: Sensational views, turquoise water, great activities, friendly staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: ROOM
reviews.title: Fantastic Holiday

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was very clean, comfortable with fantastic ocean views. It was cleaned each day and beds were made, mini bar filled up again.
reviews.title: Fantastic

reviews.text: If you can, try to buy snacks before you arrive at the resort as the mini bar is very over priced and snacks and magazines in the resort shops are extremely expensive eg. a NW is around FJ$9, a chocolate bar FJ$4.50.
reviews.title: Great Beach Holiday

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The resort provide beach towels in your room for free so no need to pack them.
reviews.title: Oh what lovely people!

reviews.text: We have just returned from a week at the Warwick on Fiji's Coast.
reviews.title: A Great Family Hotel for a 'resort style' holiday

likes.liked: — very central for exploring Fiji's main island

reviews.text: Its a very family orientated hotel with loads of amenities for kids so couples - make sure thats your thing before you book.
reviews.title: Great Time Had By All

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is about 1 hour 45 mins from the airport using the courtesy bus supplied by the Hotel. I say courtesy bus but you have to pay for it in advance when you book - dont lose your voucher (as we nearly did) as that seems to muck up the system.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: I read all the reviews before I chose our hotel and broadly speaking can absolutely recommend the Warwick for any family wanting to chill out happy in the knowledge that the kids are safe with loads to do. The food is excellent and good value if you choose a meal deal. The meal deal also gives you a 30% discount on the 'premium' italian,japanese and seafood restaurants which are off limits unless you choose the fully inclusive meal deal which we decided wasnt worth the extra cost.
reviews.title: Excellent Family Resort Holiday - March 2008 8 nights

likes.disliked: — Nothing really, it was very relaxing

reviews.text: The hotel is nicely laid out so even though its quite big you dont really get the feeling you are staying with a lots and lots of other families as sometimes happens. The Gym and Spa are good with really modern equipment but the former costs $10pp a day which we felt was a little bit tight.
reviews.title: Staff Great - Resort is a Rip Off - Stay on the Islands!

likes.liked: — Had a great view of the resort and the ocean.
likes.disliked: — AC terrible. Overpriced and too remote.

reviews.title: Dream Wedding Come True
reviews.text: My partner and I, after being messed about by another resort decided to have our wedding at the Warwick Fiji. We had friends and family from Fiji, NZ, Australia and Europe attending and we wanted it to be special, what bride wouldn't want it that way... My husband and I now know we had made the right decision to marry at Warwick. What can I say...it was absolutely fabulous! Our family all stayed between 5 nights and 8 nights and during this time they all had a wonderful experience. The staff went out of their way to make things happen, the food was fabulous, great choice of restaurants and a lot of things to do. This is what you want when you have a lot of guests attending. You want to make sure there's alot of things for them to do. The wedding itself was just a dream come true. We hired out Wicked Walu and we were not dissapointed. The staff were fantastic, the food wonderful, the string band we hired (Ofa) was just super! You must ask for Ofa if you want to have live soft music on the night. All we can say is that if you are deciding to marry you must check out the Warwick Fiji. We couldn't be happier and our photo's are just what we had hoped for. All our guests enjoyed themselves and are still talking about their experience at the Warwick.

likes.liked: — It had everything we needed and I loved that it was very clean

reviews.text: Thanks to all at the Warwick staff for making our wedding a very, very special occasion. We will definitely be back again, hopefully sooner then later!!
reviews.title: Beautiful location - exceptional (underpaid) staff

reviews.text: Lavonne & Raymond Bowyer
reviews.title: Great place to unwind and relax

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I have just returned after staying at the Warwick for 8 nights and 7 days. Considering the age of the resort (formerly the Hyatt Regency opened circa 1981) we found it to be in good shape. Beautiful setting and grounds that were well maintained.
reviews.title: Amazing

likes.liked: — Staff, Food, Views, Weather, activities, accommodation
likes.disliked: — Not one bad thing to say abount the warwick, Loved it

reviews.title: What a waste of a great location
reviews.text: Facilities were well maintained.

description: The Warwick Fiji Resort & Spa is uniquely located on a stretch of brilliant gold sand beach with crystal clear lagoons on Fiji’s famed Coral Coast. It is nestled among acres of lush tropical gardens and has long been regarded as one of Fiji’s premier holiday destination. Boasting a total of 250 carefully decorated rooms and deluxe suites, the Warwick Fiji Resort & Spa strives to offer every discerning traveler with the opportunity to fully enjoy a tropical and culturally rewarding Fijian holiday experience. The Resort offers a fine selection of exquisite dining options, including Italian, Japanese, Seafood and alternating nightly International themed buffets which are complemented by a choice of 7 bars including a swim-up pool bar. The Warwick Fiji Resort & Spa also boasts excellent conferencing facilities and its team has the versatility and the expertise to ensure that your next meeting or event is successful. An exotic location coupled with its picturesque garden setting also makes the Warwick Fiji Resort & Spa an ideal weddings and honeymoon destination. Truly a favorite amongst couples, families, groups and senior travelers, the Warwick Fiji Resort & Spa is your perfect choice for an unforgettable and inescapable tropical holiday experience.
